q: president. Jim Wallace , 49, said he understands the odds but thinks he brings an economic development and business background that Mike Pence lacks. Besides, he suggested, Mike Pence is needed in Congress. I like Mike Pence . I think he's a fantastic congressman. In fact, I think he's a treasure on the national stage, he said. "I think it would be a tragedy to lose that conservative voice in Congress." "The one thing most Hoosiers would say they don't want in Indianapolis at the Statehouse is Washington politics," Parker said. He's used to the Washington game of lay blame and be partisan. He's going to have a hard time making the transition I believe. It might be May or later before Mike Pence would formally jump into the governor's race since state law prohibits political fundraising by statewide candidates until after the Legislature's session ends in late April. believed the company needed a more mature leader. Eric Schmidt , 55, will remain an adviser to Page and Google Inc. 's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , as Google Inc. 's executive chairman. In my clear opinion, Larry is ready to lead and I'm excited about working with both him and Sergey Brin for a long time to come, Eric Schmidt said. "There is no other CEO in the world that could have kept such headstrong founders so deeply involved and still run the business so brilliantly," Page said.

for Life on Monday, Michele Bachmann is set to keynote the event's dinner tonight, and former Rick Santorum joined marchers in the cold-the only three potential Republican 2012 presidential hopefuls to appear at the annual gathering. Our economy is struggling and our national government is awash in a sea of debt. Amidst these struggles, some would have us focus our energies on jobs and spending, Mike Pence , an Indiana Republican, told the thousands of activists who gathered in Washington to march to the Supreme Court to protest the 38th anniversary of Roe vs. Wade.
